FuncDef:
The igmp snooping enable vlan command enables IGMP snooping on a specified VLAN.
The undo igmp snooping enable vlan command disables IGMP snooping on a specified VLAN. The igmp snooping enable vlan command enables IGMP snooping on a specified VLAN. The undo igmp snooping enable vlan command disables IGMP snooping on a specified VLAN. By default, IGMP snooping is disabled on a VLAN.
CLIs: undo igmp snooping enable vlan { all | { <vid1> [ to <vid2> ] } &<1-10> }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start VLAN ID.
For the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ:The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the ending VLAN ID.
For the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ:The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Enables IGMP snooping on all VLANs.
-

ExtraInfo: IGMP snooping is used on a Layer 2 device running between a Layer 3 device and hosts, allowing the Layer 2 device to listen to the multicast protocol packets exchanged between the Layer 3 device and hosts. By listening to the multicast protocol packets, the Layer 2 device maintains a multicast forwarding table to manage and control multicast packet forwarding. You need to enable IGMP snooping before implementing Layer 2 multicast.
